meanings.definition: A coarse dark brown sugar made in India by evaporation of the sap of palm trees.
meanings.sent1: The villagers enjoyed the sweetness of jaggary in their traditional desserts.
meanings.sent2: I prefer using jaggary instead of white sugar in my tea for a more natural taste.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey stole a bag of jaggary from the market and ran off with it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and comforting as a spoonful of jaggary in a cup of chai.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of jaggary filled the kitchen, reminding me of my grandmother's cooking.

meanings.sent1: The health-conscious chef decided to use jaggary as a healthier alternative to refined sugar.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother always kept a jar of jaggary in the pantry for baking her special cookies.
meanings.sent3: The kids were surprised by the unique taste of jaggary in the homemade lemonade.
meanings.sent4: His words were as sweet and comforting as a spoonful of jaggary in a cup of hot milk.
meanings.sent5: The jaggary added a rich flavor to the curry, making it a delightful meal.
